inlineContent.text: To enable enhanced understanding and more conversational interactions with Siri for your app, choose a domain and a schema that match your app’s functionality. By conforming your app intent, app entity, or your app enumeration to a schema, you ensure that Apple Intelligence understands your app’s actions and content. When you’ve identified the schema to use, leverage the
Siri’s personal context understanding, onscreen awareness, and in-app actions are in development and will be available with a future software update.

abstract.text: Make your app’s actions and content available to Siri and Apple Intelligence with assistant schemas.

doc://com.apple.AppIntents/documentation.title: Making browser actions available to Siri and Apple Intelligence

abstract.text: Create app intents and entities to integrate your app’s web browsing functionality with Siri and Apple Intelligence.
Create app intents and entities that make your app’s word processor functionality available to Siri and Apple Intelligence.

Making your app’s functionality available to Siri

abstract.text: Add assistant schemas to your app so Siri can complete requests, and integrate your app with Apple Intelligence, Spotlight, and other system experiences.

doc://com.apple.AppIntents/documentation.title: Making presentation actions available to Siri and Apple Intelligence

abstract.text: Create app intents and entities to integrate your app’s presentation functionality with Siri and Apple Intelligence.

Assistant schema conformance for types you use for camera functionality.
Assistant schema conformance for app intents that offer spreadsheet functionality.
